abstract: D Alexandra Dyer, executive director of Queens arts charity Healing Arts Initiative, was victim of lye attack in August 2015 that left her face disfigured, culmination of three-year drama with accusations of embezzlement, cover-up and collusion; charity payroll manager Kim Williams, who was accused of stealing over $750,000 and of orchestrating attack after Dyer questioned her, was among those charged.
lead_paragraph: A three-year drama involving accusations of embezzlement, a cover-up and collusion at a New York nonprofit led to a lye attack on a Queens street, and three arrests.

headline.main: Missing Money, a Vicious Attack and Slow Healing for a Charity’s Leader
headline.print_headline: Crime and Chaos Jolt a Haven of Philanthropy

snippet: A three-year drama involving accusations of embezzlement, a cover-up and collusion at a New York nonprofit led to a lye attack on a Queens street, and three arrests.
